projects.title: Product Listing
projects.desc: A sample product listing page with shopping cart. Allows adding/removing from cart, applying coupons, and calculates totals. Built as a Modern Developer project and was a great exercise in more advanced layouts

projects.title: User Profile Page
projects.desc: A user profile page demonstrating much more complex layouts, and elements.

projects.title: Image Gallery
projects.desc: A simple, but cool image gallery. A focus on layouts and transitions.

projects.title: JavaScript 30
projects.desc: Wes Bos's JavaScript 30 course. I've also built a calendar looking frontend page for the exercises to make it easier to check out the projects. This is a great course on understanding advanced JavaScript/ES6.

projects.title: Social Cards
projects.desc: I wanted to play with React on my own; no tutorials. Social cards allows the user to create a Social Card that they might use on different social media platforms.

projects.title: GIFolio
projects.desc: I LOVE GIFS! I found that Giphy had an open API and I was playing around with the new CSS Grid layout that dropped recently, so I built a fun app that you can save your favorite GIF's to.

projects.title: Sea to Sky Hotel
projects.desc: A former support client of mine was in need of refresh for their hotel property and approached me to see if I would like to take it on. Of course I would! They had struggled with latency and bandwidth issues with their last Wordpress site, so I built their site using minimal frameworks. I'm really proud of the router I built from scratch and the design I came up with. This site is fully responsive and looks great at all resolutions.

projects.title: Personal Portfolio
projects.desc: I've created this Portfolio site as a way to showcase things I've learned and what I can do. With this site, in particular, I wanted to build from scratch. In other words, no CSS frameworks, no JS frameworks (ok, except Handlebars.js, but only because I love how it seperates data from design.). Everything you see on this page was hand coded by me, and I update, usually when I add a new project to the wall of fame.

projects.title: Blue Water Canvas Works
projects.desc: A really fun project for a great client using GatsbyJS and Sanity.io CMS. This is my first project using these Jamstack technologies for a professional project and it went so smoothly, I'd turn to this stack in a second.
